subtitle: chapter 6 the eternal lover
they who possess much elemental nature
are often given visions
and as they easily enter the elemental
realms we have been privileged to record
such inspirations by a pupil
this will give the students some idea
about those realms from once inspiration
is derived
it is given in her own language
natural beauty and music are the links
that hold her to this plane
she is highly religious but of a pagan
nature
and this world seems to be one of toil
and suffering
when taken into these higher spheres she
begins to grow younger and childlike and
is happy and at peace with all things
past records sure to have possessed an
intemperate nature
and to have been a courtesan as well as
a nun but the elemental source of rabine
constantly beckons to her
having suffered greatly in past
incarnation she lost touch with her
elemental guardian
who possesses great enlightenment and
power i can trace her incarnation from
her elemental spheres
her source of enlightenment to this dark
world
though bearing her karma with rebellion
she is not divorced from these
elementals who come and guide her
thoughts
certain beings of a hierarchical nature
have also appealed to her and their
beauty and serenity
are wonderful to behold her life has
been a constant giving without as she
thinks much return
as a child she felt this world was an
illusion
she easily senses any dishonesty or
hypocrisy in people who possess sachin
has the elemental power of a self of
placing a finger upon the weak spot of a
person's character
i heard a voice had called to me saying
come my beloved and follow me
i am he who lives in land of perpetual
fragrance whose walls are of crystal
and the sound of the voice caused the
tree of love to put forth her branches
within me
the tree of love whose flowers are light
with music and whose leaves are
inscribed with gold
i sought my beloved for many days but i
fought him not neither did the echoes
voice come to me upon the wind
and i journeyed far into the valley of
despair
now while i walked in this valley from
the mountain on the farther side there
came a horseman
whose spear and shield shone and he
lifted me and carried me through the
illusion of the world where there was an
altar garland with the blossoms of
sensation and the corners of it were
carved very
curiously with the heads of rams behind
it stood one crowned and above his head
was the nimbus of the moon
he stretched out his hands and anointed
me and held towards me an ewer
out of which he drew necklaces of pearl
and sapphire and emerald
as i tossed them up to the laughter of
the sun i heard again the voice of my
beloved bidding me to sit beside the
stream of lost remembrance
now the waters of the stream run clear
yet when i put my hand in and it drew
out precious stones
and each stone had its own particular
fragrance
and from the thickets and hedges there
came fawns and elves play fellas of a
bygone age
and they decked me with the jewel
singing songs that were like the gentle
spray of fountains
and they showed me the path my beloved
had taken
like a bird that was freed happiness
soared up within me
my mind became calm and like a net that
floats upon a moonlit sea
i drifted into sleep in the distance of
a dream i saw my beloved standing beside
the watchtower of my soul
and he cried to me saying prepare the
way for i come to you with a new body
and a new mind
with a casket of precious ointment and a
chalice from the moon
the pastures of your brain will be made
fertile and your feet will spread the
net of expression to enable you to hold
the imagination of our minds
no father has begotten me no mother has
suckled me a symbol of time
and an advocate of justice i stand
serene in the resting place of silence
i am the crystal wall built about the
garden of nature on the ramparts of
which are the storehouse of
understanding
out of my land comes song and laughter
in the rhythm of the dance
my messengers run before thought with
the rush and fluttering of wings
sowing and reaping i have followed you
through the fields of yesterday
in arcadia i permeated your mind with
the dayspring of youth
for i am the eternal lover before whom
alders fade
each holds for you but a facet of me and
so cannot satisfy your hunger or swayed
your thirst
babylon was known to me through the
rights of ishtar you have worshipped me
asher heard the sound of my voice but i
remained hidden from them
egypt unveiled my face grease caster
treasures at my feet and listen to my
songs
through the eyes of many lovers i have
looked on you drawing aside my veils by
the magic of color and perfume and sound
the going down of the sun and the rising
thereof have been but links in the chain
that forged you to me
for i am he who comforted you and the
pangs of birth and folded about you the
sheltering wings of death
your eternal star
in addition to my beloved a messenger
came forth to the watchtower of my soul
he touched my foreheads that my mind was
caught up in a higher heaven
circular like a great courtyard it was
divided into 12 divisions in which
each sign of the zodiac had its place
and from each sign
wound spiral staircases that led to a
balcony of crystal
where the people of the sun walked with
the daughters of the moon
in the center of the courtyard rose of
fountain greater than one that enriched
its walls
and the sound of it seemed the source of
all music and over at high
up till it merged with the innermost
heaven curved a rainbow that paled and
quickened as the waters rose and fell
then he who guided me made me look into
the dusky cities of the world
and i saw that the only light that came
to the earth was the reflection from the
crystal wall
and where the spray of the fountain's
chance to fall that illumined the minds
of poets
it colored the brushes of painters and
made dreams stir in the hearts of men
and as i looked the spirit of fountain
spoke to me saying whom do you seek
and i thinking it was the voice of him
who i sought held out my arms crying
my beloved my beloved upon those
forehead shines the eternal star
swiftly the jagged icicle of torment
entered my heart for the voice answered
already he has journeyed far from here
seek him in the world through the door
of service
the fountain shimmer to silence the
rainbow stood still
i passed through the gateway into the
outer courtyard that i saw dimly through
my tears
leaning against the pillar for all
strength seemed to have left me
i waited and out of the shadows moved to
form and i called to it
for i thought i recognized one whom i
loved but as it came towards me up the
steps of the law guy
i saw it was no mortal but the goddess
of venus with one of her handmaidens
and i ran to her delirious with the
light under my hand i felt the roundness
of her breast and my whole body was
filled with a wonderful beauty
but when i touched her she turned and
looked at me with wounded eyes
and uttering a cry of pain fled from me
stooping i picked up a spray of blossoms
she had dropped in her flight
it seemed but lately picked from the
tree of youth for the bees of happiness
followed after it
humming the song of spring i returned to
the world fettered with poverty and fate
led me into strange paths
i who looked upon service as my right
now was called upon
to serve i heard the roar of the jungle
called
commerce where the mind of the machine
ruled supreme i saw men whose souls had
dwindled today i'd
become like shriveled leaves i heard the
hollow laughter of the rich
as within different feet they trout the
winepress of wealth demanding more and
yet more and seldom seeking to give
seeking happiness and pleasure and
finding the cask of emptiness
i moved among so many bowed with the
stress and struggle of existence
that they had almost forgotten that
there existed such a thing as beauty
to them i gave a blossom from the branch
that i carried
and where i plucked a flower another
budded in its place and those who looked
at and held these fragile petals
felt hope revive within them and
loveliness entered in
made in the mind's garden of escape from
this world
yet i was lonely and sad i caught no
glimpse of him who i saw it
he seemed distant as a rose that grows
in some far land
perfuming only my dreams
one day as i walked along a street a
figure beckoned me
and i followed her through narrow
passages and devious ways till we seem
deep under the earth and in an alcove of
the wall behind created bars i saw
something which vibrated
looking closer i recognized the stone of
remembrance that like a shuttle travels
back and forth
through the space of time putting my
hands to the bars i held it and it gave
me the power
to see into the past and to understand
the reason of suffering
that night in the vision i again saw the
beloved and in one hand he held a casket
and the other a chalice
i took the casket and opened it only to
find in it seven other caskets
and he said to me open the third casket
and when i had locked it i saw within it
an image of myself
embalmed and fined linen and he said
open the second casket
and i did so finding another body
similar to the first
but on the brow was a diadem of seven
pearls
he paid me to unlock the fifth casket
with fear i did so
and in it lay a decomposed body and
knowing that it came from the evil of my
thoughts i shrank from it in loathing
and the beloved poured over at the
contents of the chalice that he held
transforming the malice of it into the
wisdom of experience
then a voice came from the seventh
casket and at my
touch it sprang open and then it was a
sprig of amber and a mother of pearl
cunningly joined together and entwined
and i lifted it out and planted in the
earth watering with my tears
new life flowed up by the amber stem yet
its smell was rancid
but the entwining twig of mother of
pearl gave of itself and nourished it
and as it did so the amber faded to
primrose and finally into the likeness
of a pearl
the voice of the beloved cried prepare
the way for i am he who returns to you
and stooping over me he sealed my lips
yet there was singing in my heart then
looking at the casket he turned and said
to me in anger
open the first i did so and it was my
soul and kindle and it gave to me its
message
then the beloved with gentleness
unsealed my lips
opening the fourth casket he showed to
me that it contained nothing
yet as i wondered there rose from a
cloud of perfume fragrance of happiness
i had given to others
and then the sixth casket was a ball of
crystal
and looking in the crystal i saw
stretched out of heaven the great arm of
a god
and down this arm came chariots and
horsemen
all the pageant of bygone days and
entering my mind they revealed to me the
last beauty of each century
unscathed by death unmarred by time love
stood before me and he passed his hands
over the caskets
enveloping them in a rosy flame
and with my beloved and him i passed
into the glory of the sunrise
but the time for fulfillment was not yet
come i was left alone in the land of
solitude where stillness hovered with
the outstretched wings of some
menacing bird and from under the earth
came a muffled sound like the repeated
note of a tolling bell
i wandered through the desolate coldness
of the valley seeking some way of escape
but the mountains bound me in every side
in my hopelessness i prayed and as i did
so
i saw far away in the distance many men
pulling that rope that seemed
immeasurable
stretching into the very beginning of
time
guided by a light i found my way and
when i came to the place
i saw that the men were care worn and
fatigued
yet buoyant with an inward strength and
on each of their foreheads shown a
lambent flame
then i knew that they were the chain of
initiates who bear the burden of the
world and i asked their blessing
and one of them made me place my hand
over his as it clasped the rope
like an electric current there vibrated
through me the cruelty of man and the
sorrow and suffering of humanity
it crashed through my senses like
lightning till a merciful darkness
overtook me
when conscience returned i found myself
on a pinnacle of a mountain before me
stretched a path leading to an open
country
i there they're looking into the sky and
as i looked the clouds opened
and out of heaven came two hands bearing
a chalice
pouring a crystal and substance over me
i stood upright in before me rose a tree
the tree of love whose flowers are
filled with music
and whose leaves shine with gold and
about it throwing the silts of the air
the fawns and dryads of the woods and
the little people of the fields
around my neck they placed an
amaranthian garland
and the children of the moonbeam clothed
me in shimmering garments and placed a
crown of stars above my head
through the groves of arcadey they led
me to an altar
answering the voice of my beloved with
their singing and as the morning mist
has caught up
and interpenetrated by the sun i was
made one with beauty
a conquistador of love
